See also: ihr

German[edit]

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ʔiːɐ̯/

Pronoun[edit]

Ihr

  1. yours (that which belongs to you (when formally or politely addressing one or more people))
  2. (archaic) you (polite; both singular and plural)

Usage notes[edit]

In modern German, Sie (always capitalised) is used instead for politeness, while ihr is considered informal second-person plural only.

1Often capitalized, especially in letters

Determiner[edit]

Ihr

  1. your (that belongs to you (when formally or politely addressing one or more people))
    Wo ist Ihr Wagen, Frau Wagner?
    Where is your car, Mrs. Wagner?
